column4: Breakingviews - Alibaba deal guides grocers to checkout
column5: HONG KONG (Reuters Breakingviews) - Alibaba's deal suggests grocery stores are queuing up to check out. The e-commerce goliath agreed to buy 36 percent of Chinese supermarket operator Sun Art Retail for $2.9 billion. To land the stake at a massive discount implies brick-and-mortar store owners see the writing on the wall.

column4: BP seeks stake in Cairn Energy Senegal assets
column5: SYDNEY/DAKAR Oil exploration company Cairn Energy  is in talks with BP  to sell a 30 percent stake in its deepwater SNE field offshore Senegal  which could be valued at around $600 million  banking sources and a Senegal oil ministry source said on Monday.     "We are aware that BP wants to acquire a stake in Cairn Energy  but they are awaiting validation by the state (of Senegal) " an adviser to Senegal's oil minister  who declined to be named  told Reuters by telephone.

column4: US to sue to stop AT&T from buying Time Warner - source
column5: WASHINGTON  Nov 20 The U.S. Department of Justice will file a lawsuit aimed at blocking AT&T Inc's $85.4 billion acquisition of Time Warner Inc  a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-BP seeks stake in Cairn Energy Senegal assets
column5: SYDNEY/DAKAR  Nov 20 Oil exploration company Cairn Energy is in talks with BP  to sell a 30 percent stake in its deepwater SNE field offshore Senegal  which could be valued at around $600 million  banking sources and a Senegal oil ministry source said on Monday.

column4: TransCanada starts excavation work after South Dakota pipeline leak
column5: Canada Corp  has started initial excavation work at the site of an oil spill on its Keystone pipeline in South Dakota but has not yet pinpointed where the leak came from  a state official said on Monday.

column4: TransCanada starts excavation work after South Dakota pipeline leak
column5: Nov 20 Canada Corp has started initial excavation work at the site of an oil spill on its Keystone pipeline in South Dakota but has not yet pinpointed where the leak came from  a state official said on Monday.

column4: BRIEF-TransCanada evaluating Nebraska PSC decision on Keystone XL
column5: * TransCanada - confirmed that Nebraska Public Service Commission approved alternative route for proposed Keystone XL pipeline project through the state

column4: Nebraska to decide fate of controversial Keystone XL pipeline
column5: LINCOLN  Nebraska/WASHINGTON  Nov 20 Nebraska regulators will announce their decision on Monday on whether to approve TransCanada Corp’s Keystone XL pipeline route through the state  the last big hurdle for the long-delayed project.

column4: Tyson puts Kansas plant on hold  to build facility in Tennessee
column5: Tyson Foods Inc said it was putting on hold plans to build a chicken production plant in Kansas following opposition from local residents and the No. 1 U.S. meat processor said it would build a new $300 million facility in Tennessee.

column4: BHP  Vale get extension to settle $48 billion Samarco claim
column5: BHP Billiton Ltd  and Vale SA  have secured a 150-day extension from a Brazilian court to negotiate a settlement of a $48 billion claim stemming from the Samarco mine disaster in 2015  BHP said on Tuesday.

column5: Nov 21 BHP Billiton Ltd and Vale SA have secured a 150-day extension from a Brazilian court to negotiate a settlement of a $48 billion claim stemming from the Samarco mine disaster in 2015  BHP said on Tuesday.

column4: Brazil's Vale denies postponing sale of New Caledonia mine stake
column5: BRASILIA  Nov 20 Brazil's Vale SA in a securities exchange filing on Monday denied that it had decided to postpone the sale of a stake in the New Caledonia nickel mine  saying it is continuing to look for a partner.

column4: Zions Bancorp seeks to shed 'systematically important' tag
column5: Zions Bancorp on Monday said it would become the first bank to attempt to shake off its "systematically important" regulatory label  which carries with it heightened oversight and capital requirements.

column4: UPDATE 2-Zions Bancorp seeks to shed 'systemically important' tag
column5: Nov 20 Zions Bancorp on Monday said it would become the first bank to attempt to shake off its "systemically important" regulatory label  which carries with it heightened oversight and capital requirements.

column4: Zions Bancorp files petition to lose 'systemically important' tag
column5: Nov 20 Zions Bancorp on Monday said it would file a petition with the Financial Stability Oversight Council to challenge its "systemically important" status  a label that triggers heightened oversight  and forces banks to hold more capital.
